meanings.sent1: The old washing machine would coggle during the spin cycle.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the train coggle as it moved along the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The shaky bridge began to coggle as we crossed it, making us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voice coggled with nervousness as she spoke in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The loose wheel on the cart would coggle noisily as it rolled down the hill.

meanings.sent1: The gentle coggle of the boat put me to sleep on the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: The coggle of the cradle helped the baby fall asleep peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmic coggle of the porch swing was soothing on a warm afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The coggle of the tree branches in the wind created a peaceful melody.
meanings.sent5: The slow coggle of the pendulum on the clock marked the passing of time.
